headline.main: Czech Is Orbited With Russian for Salyut Rendezvous; From Other Countries Glad to Have Visitors

results.snippet: MOSCOW, March 2--A 29-year-old Czechoslovak military pilot rocketed into orbit with a Soviet colonel tonight and became the first man in space from a country other than the United States or the Soviet Union.

byline.original: By CRAIG R. WHITNEY Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, March 2--A 29-year-old Czechoslovak military pilot rocketed into orbit with a Soviet colonel tonight and became the first man in space from a country other than the United States or the Soviet Union.

results.abstract: Symbolism of choosing Czech pilot Capt Vladimir Remek as member of Russian Salyut 6 crew is seen striking because only 11 yrs ago Soviets put down liberal rebellion of 'Prague spring'; illus (S)

headline.main: Salyut Sets Record In Space as Two In Soyuz Link Up; 'Pleased,' U.S. Astronaut Says

results.snippet: MOSCOW, Saturday, March 4 (UPI)-- The Salyut 6 astronauts, Yuri Romanenko and Georgi Grechko, set a world record today for endurance in space, breaking a United States mark of 84 days.
results.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Saturday, March 4 (UPI)-- The Salyut 6 astronauts, Yuri Romanenko and Georgi Grechko, set a world record today for endurance in space, breaking a United States mark of 84 days.

results.abstract: Romanenko and Grechko are hailed by Amer space officials; are joined by Soyuz 28 cosmonauts Capt Aleksei A Gubarev and Capt Vladimir Remek; Soviet interest in manned space flight discussed; some experiments performed aboard Salyut described; importance of Remek, Czech astronaut, noted (M)

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, March 4--Two Soviet astronauts, Lieut. Col. Yuri Romanenko and Georgi M. Grechko, broke the American record of 84 days in space this morning a few hours after a Czechoslovak captain and a Soviet colonel joined them in the Salyut 6 orbital station.

headline.main: 2 Soviet Astronauts Return Safely After Man's Longest Space Flight; Some Discomfort Expected Toast From Second Group

results.snippet: MOSCOW, March 16--The longest manned mission so far in the history of space flight ended today as two Soviet astronauts rode their Soyuz 27 capsule to a perfect landing in powdery snow on the steppes of Central Asia. They had spent a record 96 days...

byline.original: By DAVID K. SHIPLER Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, March 16--The longest manned mission so far in the history of space flight ended today as two Soviet astronauts rode their Soyuz 27 capsule to a perfect landing in powdery snow on the steppes of Central Asia. They had spent a record 96 days orbiting the earth.

Rooms With a View: Papering the Walls With Nature

results.snippet: ONE DAY three years ago, Robert Johnstone, then an executive with the Quaker Oats Company, was sitting in his win  dowless office in Chicago's Merchandise Mart brooding about not having a view. It suddenly occurred to him: "What this office needs is...
results.lead_paragraph: ONE DAY three years ago, Robert Johnstone, then an executive with the Quaker Oats Company, was sitting in his win dowless office in Chicago's Merchandise Mart brooding about not having a view. It suddenly occurred to him: "What this office needs is a nature mural."
